intro: Psychotria cyanocarpa, commonly known as blue-fruited psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a globose, blue-black berry that contains several seeds. Psychotria cyanocarpa is often found in humid, shaded understory environments of tropical forests.
